Issues.Title: Setting markAsTouched() on a FormControl with CVA doesn't call the registered onTouched callback.
Issues.Body:
### Relevant Package
This feature request is for @angular/forms


### Description
I setup a custom form control with multiple fields using the ControlValueAccessor. Once it was wired up and working, I called "markAsTouched()" on the form control from the parent component, expecting the callback function onTouched that I registered via RegisterOnTouched to be called. It wasn't.


### Describe the solution you'd like
Call the registered touch function when the control is touched programmatically.  Or expose a method such as setTouchedState (https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/27315) and then access it the same way the validate(ctrl: AbstractControl) method is accessed, via the multi-provider NG_VALIDATORS.


### Describe alternatives you've considered
1. Create a separate "@Input" binding on the component through which to pass its touched status.
2. Inject the NgControl and listen directly to it for touched (although there also exists no easy way to listen to touched/dirty/pristine statuses).

Here is a reproduction of the issue:
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-cva-example-ng-conf
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Setting markAsTouched() on a FormControl with CVA doesn't call the registered onTouched callback." (#30275)

# 🐞 bug report

### Affected Package

`@angular/bazel` and `@angular/compiler-cli`

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

Currently when a `ng_module` bazel target references a Bazel generated file (`genfile`), the flat module metadata bundle that is generated by NGC does not contain the metadata of the genfile.

This can cause compilation issues when the genfile contains Angular modules
but now misses metadata. This makes the built component/module not usable in other projects.

## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction

https://github.com/devversion/ng-bazel-genfile-metadata-bundle

## 🔥 Root cause analysis

_Analysis is based on the reproduction above_

The issue appears because the metadata bundler tries to resolve
the genfile relatively to real `index.ts` source file. Under Bazel this ends
up resolving the genfile path within the `execroot/src/index.ts`, while the actual
genfile is part of the `execroot/bazel-out/../bin/src/` directory. The issue can be solved
by also respecting the genfile/bin directory when resolving the metadata of original source-files. 

https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/30d1f292c930d0ba8c198757b3333d4b594692d8/packages/compiler-cli/src/metadata/bundler.ts#L135-L145

(_see the `resolveModule` function call_)

## 🌍  Your Environment

Latest Angular version

Issues.Title: perf(ivy): avoid unnecessary function calls when bound value doesn't change
Issues.Body:
In the existing implementation the `elementPropertyInternal` function (meant to
set element properties) was executed even if a bound value didn't change. In this case the
`elementPropertyInternal` was inspecting the incoming value and after comparing it
to `NO_CHANGE` - exiting early. All in all it meant that we were unnecessarily
invoking the `elementPropertyInternal` function for cases where bound value didn't
change (unnecessarily since no property value is being set and this function doesn't do any useful work in this case).

Based on my benchmarks (running change detection without any model update in a tight
loop) this unnecessary function call was causing ~5% slowdown in the change detection
process. Also, I find the modified logic easier to follow as it is not clear that `elementPropertyInternal` 
just deals with property setting _after_ it was determined that we need to actually set it.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "perf(ivy): avoid unnecessary function calls when bound value doesn't change" (#30255)

Issues.Title: refactor(core): static-query migration should not prompt if no queries are used
Issues.Body:
Currently we always prompt when the static-query migration runs. This is not
always needed because some applications do not even use `ViewChild` or
`ContentChild` queries and it just causes confusion if developers need to
decide on a migration strategy while there is nothing to migrate.

In order to avoid this confusion, we no longer prompt for a strategy
if there are no queries declared within the project.

References #30224

Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: `@angular/cli v8.0.0-beta.4` or `@angular-devkit/build-angular v0.14.0-beta.4` (before commit 309b483). ### Description Commit 309b483 add **changes on server builder model** (`packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/angular-cli-files/models/webpack-configs/server.ts`) **which breaks option `"bundleDependencies": "none"` on Windows**. ```diff @@ -45,23 +36,15 @@ export function getServerConfig(wco: WebpackConfigOptions) { if (wco.buildOptions.bundleDependencies == 'none') { config.externals = [ /^@angular/, - // tslint:disable-next-line:no-any - (_: any, request: any, callback: (error?: any, result?: any) => void) => { + (context: string, request: string, callback: (error?: null, result?: string) => void) => { // Absolute & Relative paths are not externals if (request.match(/^\.{0,2}\//)) { return callback(); } try { - // Attempt to resolve the module via Node - const e = require.resolve(request); - if (/node_modules/.test(e)) { - // It's a node_module - callback(null, request); - } else { - // It's a system thing (.ie util, fs...) - callback(); - } + require.resolve(request); + callback(null, request); } catch { // Node couldn't find it, so it must be user-aliased callback(); ``` **After these changes, main server entry path will be consider as external/node module** (because `require.resolve` succeeded to resolve main server entry path). Consequently: * bundle server succeded to build but main server entry isn't transpile ; * bundle server run crashes due to syntax error from typescript instructions. Before these changes, Windows paths were consider as "system thing" because some path like `C:\code\src\main.server.ts` doesn't match `^\.{0,2}\/`, can be resolve with `require.resolve` but doesn't contain `node_modules`. _Temporarily fix_: we can use `"bundleDependencies": "all"` to ensure main server entry will be transpile but all server dependencies will be transpile (and bundle) too. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction > I haven't Internet access for the moment. Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): relax typescript peerDep
Issues.Body:
We only use it for a few things but have a strict peerdep.

This strictness causes errors when updating the CLI from 7.x to 8.x projects:
```
Package "@angular/compiler-cli" has an incompatible peer dependency to "typescript" (requires ">=3.1.1 <3.2", would install "3.4.5").
```
`build-angular` did not have a peerdep in 7.x so this never was a problem.

This PR relaxes the peerdep to `">=3.1 < 3.5"`, which covers the 3.1 used in initial CLI 7.0 projects.

Issues.Body: The change fixes the passed `project` option to the module, component, and service schematics used in the library schematic (`schematics/angular/library/index.ts`). Originally, `options.name` used to be passed to the respective schematics. In the case of a scoped project, however, the passed `project` option will be incorrect/incomplete due to the stripped scope from `option.name` performed earlier during the execution (https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/schematics/angular/library/index.ts#L184).

current positioning:

as you see the panel stretches only as tal as viewport permits, thus truncating the contents.

#### Is there anything else we should know?

- An example of such an implementation can be found at trello.com
- I am mentioning height only, but obviously some users might also want to allow horizontal overflow for different cases.

Menus with too many menu items in them will cause the mat-menu-panel with xPosition="before" to shift to the left and not line up correctly with the right edge of the button in IE browser. Consequently, if you add a set max-height to the mat-menu-panel to override the default 100vh calculation, the panel is still shifted to the left in IE. 

#### Bug, feature request, or proposal: Bug


#### What is the expected behavior?
mat-menu with xPosition="before" shouldn't shift left and should align correctly to the right even if the number of menu items exceed the max-height of panel in IE.

#### What is the current behavior?
mat-menu with xPosition="before" and menu items that exceed max-height of panel causes the panel to shift to the left and not align with button in IE.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
[StackBlitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-c4k7nt)

Add enough items to mat-menu with xPosition="before" until menu panel exceeds max-height. 

Screenshot shows correct behavior in FF and Chrome. Incorrect behavior is seen in last screen in IE:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17503018/57039707-f5cc3700-6c22-11e9-9299-189046dbd2dd.png)

Screenshot shows incorrect behavior in IE when overriding max-height as well:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17503018/57039757-244a1200-6c23-11e9-8671-7083c4f2c522.png)

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
Menus should display consistently across all browsers for consistent user experience. 

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Windows
Angular: 7.0.3
Material: 7.0.4
TypeScript: 3.1.6
Browsers: IE only
